Domenic: it's pretty clear Origin Policy isn't being looked into at the moment, but if it makes a comeback the ideas in https://cispa.de/en/research/publications/3214-reining-in-the-web-s-inconsistencies-with-site-policy are worth considering (via freddy)
content.formatted_body: Domenic: it's pretty clear Origin Policy isn't being looked into at the moment, but if it makes a comeback the ideas in https://cispa.de/en/research/publications/3214-reining-in-the-web-s-inconsistencies-with-site-policy are worth considering (via freddy)

content.body: Domenic: in particular I quite like the thing where you can put all your policies in a single file and then select the one to apply per page (with some kind of fallback); less sure about crossing the origin boundary though

content.body: sideshowbarker: now that https://html.spec.whatwg.org/review-drafts/2020-01/ is a Rec would it be possible to get redirects/NOTE stubs for as much of https://wiki.whatwg.org/wiki/Fork_tracking as possible? Like was done for the other specs?

content.body: https://wiki.whatwg.org/wiki/Main_Page is now deployed from a version-controlled Dockerfile and configuration, and on the latest Debian/Apache/PHP/MediaWiki, woohoo.https://github.com/whatwg/wiki.whatwg.org
